incident.message: Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `String.format(Locale, ...)` instead
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `String.format(Locale, ...)` instead
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `String.format(Locale, ...)` instead
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `String.format(Locale, ...)` instead
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `toUpperCase(Locale)` instead. For strings meant to be internal use `Locale.ROOT`, otherwise `Locale.getDefault()`.
Implicitly using the default locale is a common source of bugs: Use `String.format(Locale, ...)` instead
Not targeting the latest versions of Android; compatibility modes apply. Consider testing and updating this version. Consult the `android.os.Build.VERSION_CODES` javadoc for details.

To get local formatting use `getDateInstance()`, `getDateTimeInstance()`, or `getTimeInstance()`, or use `new SimpleDateFormat(String template, Locale locale)` with for example `Locale.US` for ASCII dates.

Must be one of: OutputFormat.DEFAULT, OutputFormat.THREE_GPP, OutputFormat.MPEG_4, OutputFormat.AMR_NB, OutputFormat.AMR_WB, OutputFormat.AAC_ADTS, OutputFormat.MPEG_2_TS, OutputFormat.WEBM, OutputFormat.OGG
Must be one of: AudioEncoder.DEFAULT, AudioEncoder.AMR_NB, AudioEncoder.AMR_WB, AudioEncoder.AAC, AudioEncoder.HE_AAC, AudioEncoder.AAC_ELD, AudioEncoder.VORBIS, AudioEncoder.OPUS

The following images appear in both `-nodpi` and in a density folder: question.png, refresh.png

The image `question.png` varies significantly in its density-independent (dip) size across the various density versions: drawable-hdpi/question.png: 24x25 dp (36x38 px), drawable-mdpi/question.png: 48x50 dp (48x50 px), drawable-xhdpi/question.png: 48x51 dp (96x101 px)
